channel.title: CVE Feed for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr
channel.description: The latest CVEs for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr

item.title: CVE-2020-10059|2024-09-17T02:07:14.701Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The UpdateHub module disables DTLS peer checking, which allows for a man in the middle attack. This is mitigated by firmware images requiring valid signatures. However, there is no benefit to using DTLS without the peer checking. See NCC-ZEP-018 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2021-3835|2024-09-17T00:15:57.193Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Buffer overflow in usb device class. Zephyr versions >= v2.6.0 contain Heap-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-122). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-fm6v-8625-99jf

item.title: CVE-2020-13601|2024-09-17T01:01:29.987Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible read out of bounds in dns read. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.3.0 contain Out-of-bounds Read (CWE-125). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-mm57-9hqw-qh44

item.title: CVE-2020-10019|2024-09-17T02:12:14.643Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: USB DFU has a potential buffer overflow where the requested length (wLength) is not checked against the buffer size. This could be used by a malicious USB host to exploit the buffer overflow. See NCC-ZEP-002 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.1 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-13602|2024-09-17T02:56:50.405Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Remote Denial of Service in LwM2M do_write_op_tlv. Zephyr versions >= 1.14.2, >= 2.2.0 contain Improper Input Validation (CWE-20), Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop') (CWE-835). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-g9mg-fj58-6fqh

item.title: CVE-2020-10021|2024-09-17T00:16:14.926Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Out-of-bounds Write in the USB Mass Storage memoryWrite handler with unaligned Sizes See NCC-ZEP-024, NCC-ZEP-025, NCC-ZEP-026 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.1 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2021-3432|2024-09-17T00:21:58.869Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Invalid interval in CONNECT_IND leads to Division by Zero. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.0 Divide By Zero (CWE-369). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-7364-p4wc-8mj4

item.title: CVE-2021-3434|2024-09-17T00:36:23.340Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Stack based buffer overflow in le_ecred_conn_req(). Zephyr versions >= v2.5.0 Stack-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-121). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-8w87-6rfp-cfrm

item.title: CVE-2020-10063|2024-09-17T04:03:51.040Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A remote adversary with the ability to send arbitrary CoAP packets to be parsed by Zephyr is able to cause a denial of service. This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10062|2024-09-17T00:51:36.140Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An off-by-one error in the Zephyr project MQTT packet length decoder can result in memory corruption and possible remote code execution. NCC-ZEP-031 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10066|2024-09-17T01:41:15.160Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Incorrect Error Handling in Bluetooth HCI core. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain NULL Pointer Dereference (CWE-476). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-gc66-xfrc-24qr

item.title: CVE-2020-10071|2024-09-17T04:19:36.893Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The Zephyr MQTT parsing code performs insufficient checking of the length field on publish messages, allowing a buffer overflow and potentially remote code execution. NCC-ZEP-031 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.2.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2020-10058|2024-09-17T01:36:46.714Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Multiple syscalls in the Kscan subsystem perform insufficient argument validation, allowing code executing in userspace to potentially gain elevated privileges. See NCC-ZEP-006 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2021-3330|2024-09-17T01:00:47.273Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: RCE/DOS: Linked-list corruption leading to large out-of-bounds write while sorting for forged fragment list in Zephyr. Zephyr versions >= >=2.4.0 contain Out-of-bounds Write (CWE-787). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-fj4r-373f-9456

item.title: CVE-2022-1041|2024-09-17T00:11:32.744Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: In Zephyr bluetooth mesh core stack, an out-of-bound write vulnerability can be triggered during provisioning.

item.title: CVE-2020-13598|2024-09-17T03:28:53.484Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: FS: Buffer Overflow when enabling Long File Names in FAT_FS and calling fs_stat. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.3.0 contain Stack-based Buffer Overflow (CWE-121). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-7fhv-rgxr-x56h

item.title: CVE-2020-10072|2024-09-17T04:15:01.100Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges in zephyr. Zephyr versions >= v1.14.2, >= v2.2.0 contain Improper Handling of Insufficient Permissions or Privileges (CWE-280). For more information, see https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/security/advisories/GHSA-vf79-hqwm-w4xc

item.title: CVE-2020-10024|2024-09-17T01:56:05.691Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The arm platform-specific code uses a signed integer comparison when validating system call numbers. An attacker who has obtained code execution within a user thread is able to elevate privileges to that of the kernel. See NCC-ZEP-001 This issue affects: zephyrproject-rtos zephyr version 1.14.0 and later versions. version 2.1.0 and later versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-5754|2024-09-16T14:17:06.146Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: BT: Encryption procedure host vulnerability

item.title: CVE-2024-6135|2024-09-16T14:47:03.957Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: BT:Classic: Multiple missing buf length checks

item.description: BT: Unchecked user input in bap_broadcast_assistant

item.description: BT: Missing length checks of net_buf in rfcomm_handle_data

item.description: BT: Classic: SDP OOB access in get_att_search_list

item.description: BT: Missing Check in LL_CONNECTION_UPDATE_IND Packet Leads to Division by Zero

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-08-01T19:32:42.668Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T16:44:28.197Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device
